data.whatIDoHere: Responsible for identifying client needs, designing solutions to meet those needs, and presenting these solutions in a compelling way that emphasizes value creation and partnership with a wide array of clients.
data.title: Senior Director, Strategic Solutions
data.bio: I am a versatile life sciences professional with nearly 25 years of experience across biopharmaceuticals, medical devices, and combination products in individual contributor and leadership roles. My career foundation began in engineering, product and process development, manufacturing, continuous improvement, and program management roles. Over time, I made a transition to focus on quality and regulatory compliance to complement my technical experience. At the intersection of these disciplines is where I have found success over the years, as I can provide solutions that are not only technically sound, but also compliant with evolving regulatory requirements and at the leading edge of industry best practices.

experience.description:
(6 months) 
CSSi delivers strategic patient recruitment, enrollment and retention to sponsors, CROs and sites. 


Responsibilities and Highlights: 

• Conducted market research and analysis to identify potential business opportunities and trends. 

• Prospected and engaged with potential clients to understand their needs and present relevant solutions. 

• Developed and maintained strong relationships with existing clients, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and retention. 

• Collaborated with cross-functional teams, including marketing and product development, to align business strategies and achieve revenue goals. 
• Prepared and delivered persuasive sales presentations to key stakeholders, addressing their unique challenges and proposing tailored solutions.

Metalytics is a startup that sells metabolic flux analysis used in biomanufacturing. I joined as the company's sole business development representative and owned the business development function. 
Responsibilities and Highlights: 

• Performed an initial review of Hubspot contacts, reorganized them by lead status, and wrote email campaign copy based on lead status. 
• Researched leads on LinkedIn, leveraged various websites (e.g. HunterIO, Apollo) to acquire email addresses, and performed outreach to prospects. Set up meetings and closed deals with major biomanufacturing companies. 
• Updated and organized contact information and deal pipelines in HubSpot. 
• Redesigned the website and designed content for LinkedIn posts.

Hill’s Pet Nutrition is a 100+ year-old pet food subsidiary of Colgate-Palmolive. My internship focused on managing 70 veterinary clinic named accounts. 

Responsibilities and Highlights: 

• Conducted on-site visits to pitch a new diet plan, educational seminars, and a VIP tier. 

• Analyzed district sales to identify geographies and product categories that were underperforming. 

• Closed sales of the new diet for 15 clinics, scheduled 5 lunch and learn events, and enrolled 10 client staff members into the VIP program. 
• Delivered a final presentation to all regional district managers and the head of sales.

NCBC is a life science economic development organization that helps bring ideas to market. In this role, I partnered with a small team focused on analyzing the need for a research greenhouse in RTP. 


Responsibilities and Highlights: 

• Conducted outreach to ~30 regional biotech companies to assess interest in a research greenhouse. 

• Investigated costs of three potential greenhouse solutions in discussions with 10+ developers and compiled lists of potential operators to oversee day-to-day greenhouse operations. 

• Presented findings to potential designers and operators to begin development of this research greenhouse.

school.name: North Carolina State University at Raleigh
North Carolina State University at Raleigh

experience.description:
I was the laboratory manager for an immunology laboratory at Duke University from 2017 to 2019. I managed the mouse colony which included genotyping mice, setting up breeding pairs, and maintaining a database of the current mouse population. I ordered all laboratory supplies and managed laboratory organization. 

I also conducted research on zika virus and microcephaly in mice. Technical skills include RT-PCR, plasmid cloning, RNA isolation, mammalian cell culture, murine footpad, IV, and subcutaneous injection, heart perfusion, cell staining and imaging, cryostat sectioning of neural tissue, virus propagation and harvest, embryonic murine neural cell isolation, ELISA, and other common assays.
At Micropore Technologies, I supported business development efforts for equipment sales including prospecting and outreach, tradeshow attendance, and presenting to prospective clients.

At Praetego, a startup pharmaceutical company, I assisted with series A funding efforts including performing due diligence on potential investors, setting up initial meetings with C-suite executives, preparing pitch decks for investors, authoring press releases, managing social media including Twitter and Instagram, and assisting with grant fund allocation plans.

data.whatIDoHere: I author and review proposals, manage accounts, support marketing initiatives, and support the Human Factors team.
data.title: Account Specialist
data.bio:
I am currently an account specialist at Kymanox, providing support in sales and business operations including account management, marketing support, proposal authorship, and Human Factors. 

I have in-depth knowledge of proposal development, account management, CRM management including WebCRM, Netsuite, and Salesforce,  equipment sales, and graphic design. I have laboratory experience in mammalian cell culture, RT-PCR, virus propagation and harvest, mouse colony management, cryostat sectioning of neural tissue, cell staining and imaging, murine footpad, IV, and subcutaneous injection, and microscopy.

I have a Master of Microbial Biotechnology from North Carolina State University and a B.S. in Zoology with a minor in genetics.

experience.role: Director, Global Quality Assurance and GMP Compliance
experience.description:
Corporate leadership role driving harmonization of global GMP and quality practices across Aptar Pharma's sites and FDA-registered laboratories. Reported to the VP of Quality for the Prescription Division. 
- Developed and deployed 30+ global SOPs covering Change Control, OOS investigations, supplier management, method validation, and QA systems 
- Led FDA-readiness program, including internal audits, harmonized QA forums, and computerized system validation (e.g., LIMS, Empower 3)

Led Quality Operations at a manufacturing site producing primary packaging and delivery systems for pharmaceutical, cosmetic, and perfumery clients. Served as ISO Management Representative.

Managed an R&D laboratory focused on evaluating compatibility between packaging systems and customer formulations (cosmetic, perfumery, and pharmaceutical). Provided technical support to commercial teams.

- Oversaw lab operations and managed a team of 2 technicians 
- Successfully qualified the lab as an approved testing facility for the Estée Lauder Companies
Led formulation and development projects for oral drug delivery technologies. Conducted lab-scale experiments and supported scale-up for manufacturing.

Coordinated clinical manufacturing operations for an experimental nucleic acid therapeutic in development for the treatment of a variety of chronic diseases and viral disorders. Reviewed production documentation and supported regulatory inspections. Developed early experience in GMP compliance and biotech production of a large volume parenteral solution.

Held multiple roles of increasing responsibility, including supervising production lines, performing QA oversight, and executing analytical testing. Gained foundational knowledge in commercial pharmaceutical operations, quality systems, and laboratory analysis.

data.bio:
I’m a bilingual (English/French) pharmaceutical executive with 20+ years of experience in inhalation and nasal spray drug products. I have led operations across CDMOs and pharmaceutical packaging manufacturers building high-performing teams and scaling compliant, efficient, and resilient operations. 

My expertise spans GMP compliance, analytical services, and technical operations across the full product lifecycle—from early development to commercial scale. I’ve successfully navigated complex site transitions, expanded capabilities, and strengthened quality systems to meet regulatory and business goals. 

✔️ Proven FDA inspection track record

data.title: Senior Director, Business Solutions and Marketing
data.bio:
Senior Director of Business Solutions and Marketing at Kymanox.

Marketing and sales professional, biomedical engineer, and project manager with 20+ years of in the biotechnology and life science industries. 

In-depth knowledge of proposal development and management, account and CRM management, digital and social media marketing, tradeshow management, corporate communications, and graphic design; on the technical side,  tissue engineering, combination products, cell culture, product development, equipment validation,  laboratory research and equipment, CGMP documentation. 

I have  a Ph.D. in Biomedical Engineering from University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.
